If <math>x, y \in \mathbb{F}^{n},</math> then <math>x+y=y+x</math>

== Proof ==
Suppose <math>x=\left(x_{1}, \ldots, x_{n}\right)</math> and <math>y=\left(y_{1}, \ldots, y_{n}\right) .</math> Then<math display="block">
\begin{aligned}
x+y &=\left(x_{1}, \ldots, x_{n}\right)+\left(y_{1}, \ldots, y_{n}\right) \\
&=\left(x_{1}+y_{1}, \ldots, x_{n}+y_{n}\right) \\
&=\left(y_{1}+x_{1}, \ldots, y_{n}+x_{n}\right) \qquad (\text{By commutivity of } \mathbb{F})\\
&=\left(y_{1}, \ldots, y_{n}\right)+\left(x_{1}, \ldots, x_{n}\right) \\
&=y+x
\end{aligned}
</math>
